story:
Help us save trees, save backs, reduce greenhouse emissions and keep Himalayan children, nuns and monks warm this winter!

The Himalayan Rocket Stove is a simple, effective and efficient method for burning wood. This method is clean and the impact on the environment is minimal. Best of all this technology already exists and has been proven to work, but until now, has not been adapted to Himalayan conditions.

We are at this moment able to offer a single unit that will heat a room, heat water, and serve as a large cooktop simultaneously.

The Himalayan Rocket Stove will revolutionise heating and cooking in the Himalayas by providing highly efficient stove technology. We aim to stem the tragic loss of trees & intense deforestation that is a result of ever-growing demand on wood for heating and cooking, due to increasing population.

These days telecommunication is part of everyday life for the average Himalayan family. Mobile phone technology allows people to stay connected to each other in ways that was previously impossible. Our stretch goal is to develop a phone charging and LED lighting kit that will work directly from the heat of the stove. In remote regions where the power supply is unreliable and often non-existent throughout the winter months this will be invaluable. 

Based on fuel consumption figures, each Himalayan Rocket Stove in the field saves 1 mature tree from being felled each and every year of operation. Our stoves are built to last at least 7 years of continuous operation and longer with servicing.


What is this project actually funding?

We have been fortunate to receive a grant from a charitable trust that recognised the valuable contribution this project offers the Himalayan region.

This means we will be able to go into production later this year with our first viable prototype for field assessment. 

We will do this in India, creating local employment at all stages of the process, from manufacture to distribution to sales and service. 

Four groups have been identified as the most in need and least able to afford efficient heating solutions so we will donate stoves funded by this project to these groups. 

Funds raised via this campaign will go directly towards getting Himalayan Rocket Stoves out to schools, nunneries and needy monasteries throughout the Himalayan region, as well as to low income families.

Our initial production run will serve as a test for ongoing and larger production runs in coming years, with the ultimate goal of saving thousands of trees in the Himalayas. That's a lot of carbon that won't end up as smoke in the atmosphere, and a lot backs that will benefit from the greatly reduced loads they will carry. 



What is a Himalayan Rocket Stove?

Most heating and cooking in the Himalayas is done on basic wood combustion stoves which consume large amounts of wood and where most of the heat exits via the chimney and is lost, creating lots of smoke and CO2 emissions. 

The efficiency rating of these basic combustion stoves is around 15%, which means that 85% of the energy generated in the combustion process is lost. 

A 'Rocket Stove' is an innovative design that uses small sticks and wood in a combustion process that is highly efficient, burning cleanly at high temperatures releasing large amounts of heat energy that can be effectively used in multiple ways.


In a Rocket Stove, efficiency is around 90% effective use of energy, with minimal losses to the atmosphere. 

This stove is designed to meet the needs of a typical Himalayan family. We are calling it the Himalayan Rocket Stove to distinguish it from other variations on rocket stove designs that already exist. 

Small sticks and wood are the preferred fuel source, and in many regions these are available in sustainable amounts that don’t require felling mature trees. 

Legally and illegally harvested timber is decimating the grand forests of fir, cedar and deodar that cover the mountain sides of the lower Himalayas. 

Rocket stoves are relatively simple to make, yet have very specific design parameters in order to be effective. Our challenge was making one low to the ground so as to be accessible for cooking from a seated position.

After 2 years of research and prototyping, we have now managed to complete a design that works with our particular set of criteria. 

This project will manufacture and deliver highly efficient fuel stoves to the people of the Himalayas where they are most needed.


What makes the Himalayan Rocket Stove special?

The Himalayan Rocket Stove in its final form combines four features into one unit, with many associated benefits.

1. Cooking Surface
2. Room Heating
3. Water Heating
4. Phone Charging and Lighting (optional extras - based on reaching our stretch goals)

Our design will appeal to villagers in the Himalayas as it easily fits into the space currently allocated to their traditional style of stove, and yet offers greatly improved efficiency that will reduce their fuel demand by a factor of 4 to 5 times.

We will integrate a water jacket into the design that will allow for water to be heated and drawn off on demand, or left in the heater to act as a heat bank that will radiate into the room after the fire has gone out. 

Small thermo-electric generator (TEG) modules will generate small amounts of current, sufficient to charge a mobile phone and power LED lights fixed to the stove.


Benefits to Himalayan families and environment

There are so many benefits to this kind of stove being used in the Himalayan context beyond just heating and cooking. The main benefits are listed below:

1. Use less wood. We estimate that for every single Himalayan Rocket Stove installed in the community, we will save 1 mature Himalayan tree from being felled each year! 


2. Save money and environment. The average family uses 1-2 cords of wood per season. It takes a tree with a 22 inch diameter at breast height (that's a mid sized mature tree) to make 1 cord of wood. So each family is using the equivalent of 1 or 2 trees each season. That costs money and the environment, and is profoundly unsustainable. 


3. Save time. If the family is sourcing their own wood (which most do) it takes many hours in a week to collect all the wood requirements for heating and cooking. In preparation for the long, cold, snowed in winters of most regions this work is usually done by the women and children of the household during the summer months. This is time that could otherwise be spent more enjoyably in other activities. 


4. Reduced loads saves backs. Since this stove prefers smaller twigs and sticks, many of which grow sustainably on local trees, the need to carry large logs over perilous terrain is vastly reduced. Collecting wood is a dangerous activity that requires continual foraging further afield to source wood supplies on steep mountain slopes. It also places incredible stresses on the body. Many older women are permanently stooped as a result of years of carrying heavy loads. 


5. Sustainable harvesting. In the current way of gathering wood, large branches are being cut faster than they can grow back and trees have started dying off. Mature trees are being felled and not replaced due to soil erosion, grazing and other factors. With this stove, small branches that grow back each year can be harvested sustainably. 


6. Hot water on tap. Most families still heat water either on their stoves, or on a separate fire outside the house. As a result, hot water for washing or for cleaning dishes in the evenings is either inconvenient or simply not available at all. Our system will provide 20 - 30L of hot water as a byproduct of heating and cooking each evening, rather than having to separately heat up a pot outside in the summer or often not at all during the snowy winters. 


7. Phone charging and light. With the water and power module installed, the Himalayan Rocket Stove will provide light from the attached LED lamp, as well as phone charging for multiple handsets. This feature will be very useful where electrical power is often sporadic & will be included as an optional extra for those in need. 


8. Clean air. In the winter wood smoke pollutes the fresh mountain air of the valleys of the Himalayas, and adds to respiratory issues. Our system burns so cleanly that there is only a small amount of smoke during the first 5 - 10 minutes of lighting up, after which there is no visible sign of smoke.


What we need to proceed

The development process is made up of 4 main parts:

  1. Prototyping (currently well underway in Australia)
  2. Testing (build and install multiple units in India for winter season deep testing) 
  3. Production (design and establish the mass production process in India)
  4. Distribution (set up distribution networks into the remote regions where they are needed the most)

I am currently at the end of Phase 1 with prototypes currently in local testing phase. The results so far are very promising, with a working unit ready to model our Indian test units on.

I am ready to go to the next phase where multiple test units will be built in India and installed into various situations in different parts of the Himalayas (with differing parameters) and their performance monitored throughout the winter. 

With this crowdfunding campaign, we will be able make enough units in our first season of production to get them out to schools, nunneries and needy monasteries throughout the Himalayan region, & as well make more available to low income families. 

Every Stove Saves 1 Tree Every Year



The Impact

There are approximately 10 million households (with an average 5 occupants) in the Indian and Nepalese Himalayas. Most of which use wood stoves in some capacity, either for cooking, heating or both. 

Even if we only count 10% of this potential market as being viable, that's 1 million households, not counting schools, nunneries and monasteries of which there are many thousands. 

  • 1 million households burning wood inefficiently equates to 1+ million mature Himalayan trees per year being consumed unnecessarily. 
  • For each 1% of these households where we replace their stoves, that's 10,000 Himalayan Rocket Stoves saving on average 10,000 trees per year.
  • Means there will be more families with more funds for food and education, cleaner air, less health risks and greater self reliability.
  • Over the lifetime of this project, our aim is to make high efficiency fuel stoves the norm, saving millions of trees and supporting a better quality of life for the people of the mountains. 


Risks & Challenges

Having worked and travelled in Himalayan India on and off over the previous 25 years, mostly in the travel and tourism sector, I am familiar with working in India and some of the challenges that presents.

Challenges

  • Doing business in India. It will be a legal requirement to go into business in India that we will need to do so as a Joint Venture, requiring an Indian partner in the local production business. I have several contacts to follow up in this regard. 
  • Competition and duplication. We encourage imitation over the long term, for all of the associated wider benefits to the people and environment that will result from a wider uptake of this technology. We need to prove to the market the benefits of these stoves, making sure our stoves are effective and long lasting, otherwise there is potential for backlash and resistance to develop.  
  • Production. India has very well established manufacturing and industrial facilities which we will be looking to collaborate with in the short term. In the long term we will set up our own manufacturing plant for ongoing production. 
  • Distribution. The Himalayan regions we are targeting are vast, intricate and home to many culturally distinct subgroups, many of whom do not travel to large centralised "shopping nodes" on a regular basis. Our plan is to take the stoves to them, employing locals in our distribution network. 

Perks Explained

We are offering several options for supporting this project. All funds will go towards making and distributing stoves. 

1. Everyone ($10 and up) who supports us goes onto the email list and will be kept up to date with progress. You can leave this list at anytime. 

2. Everyone from $45 and up will also receive a personalised hand drawn certificate of appreciation from the kids of Serkong School in Tabo. 

3. Everyone from $90 and up will also receive an email with links and information to try your own rocket stove projects. Great for kids and also adults with an interest in this amazing technology. There will be various projects for different levels of expertise. 

4. At $280 - you will be subsidising the production and sale of a stove to a low income family. This will be assessed by locals who know and understand the subtle politics within each region. The reason we don't give units away to families is due to the well understood phenomenon that something for free is not valued, and would devalue the whole project in the eyes of recipients. Personalised photo with your recipient family will be sent to you via email.

5. At $360 - we can afford to give a complete stove to an institution in need (schools and nunneries in particular are needy, as well as some poorly funded monasteries). By giving to these institutions, we don't devalue the project in the community, as it is well accepted to give gifts and charity to these institutions. Personalised photo with your recipient class / nuns / monks will be sent to you via email.

6. At $1080 - we know that many of you have had your own experiences and made connections in the Himalayas, and this is a way to give directly to the places / people you have that connection with. We can afford to deliver 3 units with a personal message from you for this amount, and take a personalised photo with your recipients to be sent back to you via email. If you don't have a particular destination in mind, and still want to use this perk, we will choose a suitable needy destination for you, and still send you the personalised photo showing you where your stoves ended up. 

7. At $5000 - for those who want to come and see the stoves in action in the field. Out of these funds 50% will go directly to the Himalayan Rocket Stove project, and the rest will go towards funding your expenses-paid journey to the Himalayas with Yak Trak - unique journeys (owned and operated by Russell Collins). You will need to cover your flights to India, your travel insurance, visa and other travel details, while your journey in India will be fully funded from Delhi airport onwards in comfort and style. Read more about this here: https://yaktrak.com/package/himalayan-rocket-stove-tour-2017/


Other Ways You Can Help

This crowdfunding campaign will help us get more stoves into the field in India. We know we have a design that works, and we have enough funds to start the production process. 

The more we raise now, the more stoves we can produce in the first production run, the more people we can reach sooner and the more trees we can save in the long run. 

  • Please share this link to your Facebook! Your help to spread the word about this campaign and how many trees can be saved if we get this to mass production phase is crucial. 
  • Join our email list and stay up to date with our progress. We will also make regular updates on our facebook page and website.

story:
Mein Name ist Tobias Zimon,

auf diesem Weg möchte ich einen Kleingarten auf Vordermann bringen. Dieser wurde jahrelang nicht gepflegt, war völlig mit Brombeeren zugewuchert und soll nun neu "erwachen".  Ungefähr 430qm müssen bearbeitet werden.  

Er soll ein Ort zum Wohlfühlen und Lernen und Austoben für meinen Sohn Henry werden, damit er den Kontakt zur Natur in der heutigen zubetonierten Welt behält.
Ich möchte ermöglichen das er Lernen kann wie wichtig Pflanzen für den Menschen sind, wie aus einem Samen zum Beispiel ein Baum wird und auch das Zerfall etwas Natürliches ist und sogar Nützlich ist.

Henry ist nun fast zwei Jahre alt und spielt wie jeder kleine Junge gerne mit Erde und Werkzeug ( so gut wie er eben mit einem Gärtnerspaten umgehen kann! ).

Der gesammelte Betrag soll für eine professionelle Überarbeitung des Gartens genutzt werden. Allein und mit einem Vollzeitjob kann ich das nicht leisten - zeitlich und finanziell.

Es soll, mit kompetenter Beratung durch einen Fachmann, eine Grundstruktur geschaffen werden und die Auswahl und der Standort bestimmter Pflanzen soll stimmig sein. Mein Ziel ist ein durchdachter gemütlicher Garten der sowohl Erholung, Hobby und Lernerfahrungen Platz bietet.

Nach geglückter Finanzierung und beendeter Aufarbeitung des Gartens erhält jeder
Spender eines Betrages von 5 € oder höher eine Bilderserie der Entwicklung dieses Projektes per Email zugesendet. Bitte hinterlasst einen privaten Kommentar mit Spendernamen und Emailadresse für den Versand der Bilderserie.

Gerne kann man mich auch durch eigene Arbeitskraft oder Spende von Setzlingen oder kleinen Obstbäumen unterstützen.

Sollte das Crowdfundingziel nicht erreicht werden, werde ich den gesammelten Betrag dem Kleingärtnerverein "Am Volksgarten e. V." in Mönchengladbach spenden.

Bitte Unterstützt dieses Projekt  indem Ihr es bekannt macht, darüber sprecht oder das Indigogo-Tool nutzt oder indem Ihr spendet. Vielen Dank!

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Fen Wang, an environmental, climate and sustainability activist, who is passionate for a greener planet cause. 
  • It is something deep rooted in my mind, I always feel that this might be the reason why I was selected by God to come to be born on Earth. I have been a volunteer for 3 years till now at GreenEarthCitizen, and have donated numerous time, energy and money from my own pocket into this cause. But this is not enough, and I will keep devoting myself into this cause, it is driven by my love to nature and mother earth! The cause is my mission!
  • GreenEarthCitizen exists to advocate conserving the fragile Earth. It needs Change, it needs actions of YOU, Planet Earth is YOU and YOU are the solutions. We are here to foster the society transition to green economy and sustainable development.
  • All the money raised from this campaign will be used to the administrative cost to produce twi-monthly GreenEarthCitizen Magazine, our target readers shall be citizens, NGOs leaders, CEOs, and decision-makers in governments and international organizations.
  • To make us achieve our objective, we truly need your generous support! we are working for you, for our children and grand-children. So let us start our journey to create a better future for them. Let us be the change together, your support is critical to us.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need 20,000 USD to get started with the implementation of the first process of this project. 20% of the funds-raised will be used for the administration cost for this Earth Magazine Project. 
  • We have a beautiful calendar designed by our Canadian member Elena, we have a beautiful E-book with great inspirations and pictures of nature in it to give it to you; we have our research publications to give to you, and the first e-copy of our magazine will be given to you!
  • Even if we don't reach the goal, we will still use the funds for this Earth Magazine Project.

The Impact

  • The project will help promote new paradigms of values for sustainable development, which include values for the rule of law and more democratic, open and inclusive good governance, the project will thus benefit the contributors and the world, because the carriers of these values will work for a better world cause.  
  • Last time, we are very thankful for the contributors who helped us make the video that promote the awareness of climate change, which is online now. Available at, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e2hmRri5sZI.
  • All the money raised from this campaign will be used to produce twi-monthly GreenEarthCitizen Magazine, our target readers shall be citizens, NGO leaders, CEOs, and decision-makers in governments and international organizations.

Risks & Challenges

  • Due to the fact that not every country is open for our new paradigms of values for sustainable development, particularly when we think that the rule of law and democratic, open and inclusive governance values shall also be included in order to achieve the post-2015 sustainable development goals.
  • We will make our articles as object as possible, we will play safe when it would touch the areas of politics and religions.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Friends, please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools to help our campaign reach out!

story:
Preserve Monroe is a coalition of landowners, residents, businesses and organizations in Monroe County, WV. Preserve Monroe encourages citizens to participate in the responsible stewardship of our resources to assure the healthy and prosperous future of Monroe County and our families.


Preserve Monroe opposes the attempt by private corporations to build large, 42-inch interstate transmission pipelines through our county. These pipelines would cut across our mountains, streams and farmlands carrying natural gas to points east and overseas. We are united by concern that these large excavation and construction projects—as well as the long-term presence of high-pressure gas pipelines of this magnitude—are a very real threat to our water, to our families and community, and to our property values and landowner rights.

Preserve Monroe welcomes all who love Monroe County. Join us today !

PRESERVE MONROE COUNTY FROM INTERSTATE PIPELINES:

Two large, interstate pipelines are being proposed to transport natural gas from the Marcellus shale operations in northwestern West Virginia to major interconnector lines in Virginia. In the case of one (Mountain Valley Pipeline), the pipeline is expected to be 42 inches in diameter, capable of transporting 2 billion cubic feet of gas per day. It would require 75 feet of permanent easement, with 125 feet easements for construction. This pipeline has NOT been approved yet. It is at the beginning of an extensive review process by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC).

3 REASONS Why Monroe County Landowners Are Saying “NO”

1. Threats to Our Water Supply

2. Dangers to Our Families and Community

3. Reduced Property Values / Loss of Landowner Rights

It’s Pain, No Gain for Monroe County


Why we need your contribution:

Preserve Monroe is a dedicated group of volunteers who are devoting their time and energy to furthering the goal of stopping the pipeline. The funds we raise will be used to pay for the following, as well as other costs associated with fighting the Mountain Valley Pipeline and preserving our unique county.

Public Awareness Campaigns
- County-wide Every Door Direct Mailing campaigns
- Announcements in local newspapers
- Public meeting hall rentals (where applicable)
- Steering Committee weekly meeting space
- Preserve Monroe phone line

Administrative Fees
- Website domain name fee
- Web-hosting fee
- WV annual business registration fee


General Consumable Supplies
- External hard drives to store information
- Dvd's for videos and photos (for landowners, FERC, USFS, etc)
- Legal advice
- Sign-making materials
- Home printing paper and ink (some volunteers can afford to donate, others need to be reimbursed)
- Professional printing
- Postage stamps, envelopes

Even if you are unable to make a donation to this campaign, please share it with your friends and neighbors!

story:
In Short

I write fiction, but I like to be honest! In the Gaia Girls book series, our heroines use fantastical powers based on real-world science to address environmental issues. In Book Three, Gaia Girls Air Apparent, I will also include issues of social justice and the public commons. I need to meet the people who's story I'm attempting to tell!

Our Needs & Your Perks

The total budget for myself and my "media ninja's" trip to Ecuador and Peru is $9,200.00 These funds will be used for travel expenses, accommodations, supplies, support team members (I need a translator!) and support for organizations assisting my research. In addition to crowdfunding, we have applied for several small grants and are seeking sponsors. 

YOU can  join us on the adventure! Depending on your gift level, you can enjoy such perks as

  • Update videos that tell "the story behind the story"
  • Unpublished story of "Earth Girl" Elizabeth BEFORE she became a Gaia Girl
  • Your very own Gaia Otter!
  • Acknowledgement in the book
  • A Signed First Edition of Gaia Girls Air Apparent
  • An author's visit!

The Impact

Gaia Girls Enter the Earth won the National Outdoor Book Award; Gaia Girls Way of Water won a Nautilus Book Award, given to books that can inspire change in the world. The story of Gaia Girls Air Apparent will help readers be more aware of their own ecological "footprint," the interconnectedness of all living creatures on Earth, and their role in redefining the future.

Teachers LOVE the read-aloudibility (is that a word?) of Gaia Girls, and the opportunity to have an ELA (English/Language Arts) activity that can inform science and math lessons. (Did I mention the illustrations have hidden codes?)

As all life long readers know, the books we read when we are 8-12 years old have a lasting impact on our thinking and perspectives. Your support of Gaia Girls Air Apparent helps bring a story to life that teaches the power of group effort, the value of indigenous cultures, and the uniqueness of human creativity.


    International travel CAN be risky and challenging! 

    Your support ensures we will have a translator to transcend language barriers, and can afford travel and accommodations that are as safe as possible. If we do not meet our funding goals, we still endeavor to go, but possibly without visiting all the communities and activist we would like to.


      No Dough? No Problemo!

      If you can't donate, please use the power of social media and the share button to help get the word out! You can also help by checking with your local library to see if they know about the Gaia Girls Book Series.

story:
Our first campaign was successful in gifting a dozen hives, equipment, training and support to a dozen Navajo who requested hives. We also were able to introduce Anglos to Navajo and share in a barbecue that created long lasting friendships. 

 

We have had requests from another dozen Navajo who want hives and some suggested we create an apiary of three hives at the permaculture farm near Four Corners where we did the training. We would like to do that and need your help to buy more hives, bees, equipment and put on another day of training. 

 

We also plan on planting an acre of pollinator garden and 100 native bees nests.

We also were able to introduce Anglos to Navajo and share in a barbecue that created long lasting friendships.  We have had requests from another dozen Navajo who want hives and some suggested we create an apiary of three hives at the permaculture farm near Four Corners where we did the training. We would like to do that and need your help to buy more hives, bees, equipment and put on another day of training.  We also plan on planting an acre of pollinator garden and 100 native bees nests.

story:
Using Non-Toxic Pesticides to Protect Earth

There is more to treating pests then meets the eye.  For instance unless you live in Iceland, Greenland or Antarctica there are one or more of over 22,000 different species of ants alone that could be invading your home as you are reading this message.  We know because we have developed a non-toxic way to treat not only ants, but also most other pests while protecting our environment at the same time.

Who are we?

Pest Tech Center, has been developing ecologically sensitive products to get rid of pests since its inception in 2011.  The company was started in response to growing consumer concerns about what the human impact of using poisons and other gas fumigation methods currently being used by conventional exterminators.

The company has developed a wide range of non-toxic products designed to treat insect and rodent infestations in industrial, commercial and residential properties.  The ingredients used in our products are scientifically proven natural ingredients making them safe for homes, offices, schools, restaurants and other commercial establishments.


Pest Tech Center has experienced rapid growth and now has its own development, manufacturing, packaging and shipping facilities at its headquarters in Kent, England.  Due to its online retail operation it has been able to acquire an international customer base supplying products to domestic, commercial and professional users on five continents.

Our Campaign/Where the Funds Will Go?

Realizing the significance of what we are doing and wanting to not only expand our product line but also be able to make it more affordable, we are looking to accomplish the following:

.  To buy our raw materials in bulk, in order to reduce the cost of production which will bring down our product prices and compete with conventional pesticide products in the market

·  To do more research on non-chemical agricultural pesticides, thereby eliminating pesticides in our foods

·  To advertise our products and create more awareness about an alternative non-chemical pesticide as an alternative to poisonous and dangerous chemicals

·  To lease more warehouse space

·  To improve on our product packaging

In order to accomplish this we are raising £40,000. All of us should want to protect the environment any way we can.  Pest Tech Center is putting their money where their mouth is.  We should be able to do so much more with your help.  The faster we can accomplish our goals the faster we can benefit more customers and do our part in helping to keep the environment clean.

What Are The Challenges?

The good news is there is very little competition with exterminators who use non-toxic chemicals in their products.  The bad news is that what we are doing takes research, time and money in order to present the best non-toxic chemicals we can produce at competitive prices.  We want to not only compete with conventional competition; we want to beat our competition.  You can help us do that with your donation.  If you are not concerned with what is happening to our environment then by all means use our competitor.  But if you want to help us clean up the environment but do it with a cleaner, safer more affordable product then please join us by donating whatever you can afford.


What is your reward For Donating?

In addition to the mental satisfaction of assisting us we want you to try our product.  Each contributor will receive the following as our thanks for supporting what we feel is a noble cause:


1)  4 pieces of 20ml - Pest Tech Gel Cockroach (one year supply) = £30

2) 4 pieces of 20ml - Pest Tech Gel Ant (one year supply) = £30

3) 4 pieces of 20ml - Pest Tech Paste (one year supply) = £30

4) 4 pieces of 60ml - Pest Tech Gel Cockroach = £50

5) 4 pieces of 60ml - Pest Tech Paste = £50 

6)  1 piece of each of all our products (cockroaches, ants and rodents) =   £100

7) 4 pieces of each of all our products (cockroaches, ants and   rodents) = £200

8) 16 pieces of each of all our products (cockroaches, ants and   rodents) = £500

Note:  A minimum £5 donation will also get you a thank you letter, a newsletter about the progress of the campaign and an update on events as they unfold. 


Why are we giving so much away to our donors?  There are two reasons:

·  You deserve it for caring about our planet just as we do

·  We know once you use our product you will tell others about it


Dealing with Pests While protecting The Planet

At Pest Tech Center we have already proven there is a better way to handle pest control other than using poisons, baits and other dangerous chemicals.  Our goal now is to continue development of these organic pesticides and get the message out to everyone you do not need to use chemicals to eradicate any pest.  Our products are made entirely from natural ingredients and are designed to eliminate ants, cockroaches, mice and even rats quickly and efficiently while saving mother earth.  You can help us do that.

story:
As Gandhi has inspired, we are being the change and invite you to join us. 

How can you make a difference in the world? One of the most empowering answers is - Change yourself! So we are.

If you like our plan, we want to help you to do the same. Ron, my partner, and I have been inspired to help with some of today’s challenges (global warming, unsustainable practices, feeling disengaged and unenergetic, lack of confidence in our government system, etc.). We have taken the plunge to live lighter on Earth, feel healthier and enjoy life more.

We started our change by joining an eco community called TierraLuz in Sayulita, Mexico (north of Puerto Vallarta). Together, the community members are creating sustainable processes to support a more tranquil environment that is in harmony with nature.

Does this idea appeal to you too? If so, GREAT! I think you will like what you will learn next…

Ron and I plan to build a showcase eco home and training centre. The experience is to empower other like-minded individuals, families and organizations to experience and explore the change for themselves. The retreats will incorporate nature, community, eco friendly technology, sustainable processes and spirit. I have created this crowdfunding initiative to fund the Sayulita ECO RETREATS project. This project will be managed through a company I own called nPRES Consulting. See my bio below to learn more.

“A good example has twice the value of good advice.”– Author Unknown

First Draft of the Property Layout

What do the perks include?

Special for this crowdfunding initiative, Sayulita ECO RETREATS will offer experiential opportunities to practice and explore eco living. Select your level of engagement.

  • Tours
  • Workshops
  • Retreats
  • Eco home rental

More details of these opportunities is provided below under Sayulita ECO RETREATS Crowdfunding Special Perks. There are also sponsorship opportunities for businesses who develop eco friendly, sustainable technology. See the Sponsorship section below.

Participate in this crowdfunding initiative and you will also be supporting a chain of sustainable efforts. There are others within the local community who are promoting sustainable practices that we support, such as the development of the TierraLuz eco community and a local eco school called Costa Verde International School. Money raised involving tours to this local community initiatives will result in a donation to their cause.

The luscious TierraLuz eco community is a beautiful span of green land pressed up against jungle. The community members have various stunning views of jungle and ocean. Common areas are being developed to contribute to their collaborative, sustainable practices. They are currently in the middle of development. To further develop and maintain the community, a donation fund has been created. Sayulita ECO RETREATS will donate $20 USD to this fund for every perk sold involving the TierraLuz tour.

The Costa Verde International School runs solely on fundraisers and donations. Their small school environment is mostly open to nature with the food they eat for lunch growing around them. The students' learning environment is one big sustainable system and truly amazing to comprehend. Andy Slavin, Costa Verde International School Director, will provide you with a tour of their systems and share the sustainable values and practices they teach the students. Andy has over 20 years of experience in education. Before this position, he was the Principal of the Green School in Bali, Indonesia. He has much to share about sustainable processes and eco friendly practices. Sayulita ECO RETREATS will donate $20 USD to the school for every perk sold involving the eco school tour.

“Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle” – Buddha

Proposed Lot in TierraLuz

The property is located at the top of eco community with a view of the ocean and jungle. The eco-community is a 20-minute walk away from the soft, sandy beach near downtown Sayulita. The location is perfect because it is close enough to town to get there quickly with an electric golf cart, yet far enough to drown out the noise from the late night partying.

Floor Plan for Eco-Home

We have hired Jorge Siemen, Architecture and Design, to create the layout of the property structures. The image above is the first draft. The layout of the home has 3 bedrooms. It’s organized so that the whole home or individual suites can be rented out. The home and the training centre will balance the use of local and natural building materials (rocks/earth bags/etc.) and other creative solutions to meet home needs (e.g., solar energy, water waste systems, etc.) while minimizing costs. The training centre is located lower on the hill near the parking lot and can accommodate a maximum of 20 people. We are currently working through the sustainable processes, experimenting with options.

You may be familiar with recycling your glass/plastics/paper.  You may even drive an eco-friendly vehicle.  But does your home recycle rain water?  Is your bodily waste turned into compost?  Is your grey water redirected to a pond where it is naturally filtered to water your outdoor plants? Is your counter-top made by local artisans or was it imported from another country?  Do you know where your veggies come from?  How about your eggs or cheese...fish or other meats? Keep your own bees and make your honey?  Dehydrate and can your own food. We may be doing this. Maybe not all on our own, but as a thriving community. Our eco community ideas are still coming together. And we want to show you how we do this and why it is important!

Risks & Challenges

We have done our homework with the industry trends, location and the direction our future is taking us. Sayulita ECO RETREATS combines the industries within today’s leading trends: Tourism and Wellness. In addition, the project serves the public’s interests to learn about sustainability and take more meaningful action. This is referred to as Ecotourism or Sustainable Tourism. To make it accessible, Mexico is an ideal location. It is a common personal or business retreat location for North Americans. It is also one of the more affordable locations. This project is needed. More advocates are sharing the environmental changes we are going to be forced to deal with. If there is a time to come together and learn, it’s now. We want to create the space.

When Ron and I have shared our ideas within our networks, many have expressed their interest in our project. In fact, some have already visited Sayulita as a result of our discussions. There is no question there is interest in what we are doing and its benefits. There is also no question in our level of commitment. Personally, we have invested over $50,000 USD to this project. We have already grounded our commitment to make it happen, it is now time to build.

We are currently working on the designs of the property and structures. The eco-community members have been sharing their experience and knowledge to help us to succeed. There are a number of approvals we still need to receive through the eco-community and the Mexican government. Besides the building of the project, we are also learning a new culture and government system. We plan to continue to work towards our milestones and deal with unforeseen circumstances as they arise. We appreciate all the support we have received already. We hope you will join us and be the change.

Where will the money go?

  1. To the construction of the model eco home and training centre
  2. To the start-up costs of Sayulita ECO RETREATS

Any money left-over will be invested to empower others who are working towards the same vision.

Tell me more!

Doreen Teaching

Sayulita ECO RETREATS Crowdfunding Special Perks:

Sayulita ECO RETREATS is offering special perks for this crowdfunding. You will not find these offers on our website. They include tours, workshops, retreats and eco home rental. Contributors have the opportunity to attend tours of the new eco home, TierraLuz eco community and Costa Verde International School. The ECO Tourist perk is a cost-saving offer to engage in three tours within Sayulita. This offer is not offered by any other service provider.

A special ECO Living Overview workshop will be offered to only crowdfunding contributors. I will facilitate a 3-hour workshop and review various eco living topics to function in the modern world (find my bio below). Resources, discussions, activities and a tour will be facilitated. The workshop will also be held in the new training centre built with the crowdfunding money raised. Some of the sustainable practices discussed will be used during the workshop to give you a practical experience. Also, an organic vegetarian meal will be provided will food locally grown. By the end of the workshop, you will have...

  • Discussed the systems involved in eco living,
  • Created a non-toxic hygiene product,
  • Reviewed renewal energies and eco friendly technology,
  • Considered harmonic energy placement of elements within your home and yard
  • Toured through the new eco home in the TierraLuz eco community

When we are ready to build, ECO Building retreats will be coordinated for individuals interested in learning about the earthen building process. This will be a 5-day retreat that will involve 4-hour sessions each day filled with instruction and hands-on community building projects. A local builder and other local workers will accompany the retreat participants to assist in the process and provide leadership. This experience will be cultural as well as educational. An organic lunch will be provided each day. Plus, a massage. Accommodations, travel and insurance will not be included in the perk, however, assistance can be provided through Sayulita ECO RETREATS. Hotel, home and camping rentals are available in Sayulita. This opportunity may be available as early as February 2016. More instructions will be provided to contributors in preparation of this retreat.

Lastly, one and two-week eco home rentals will be made available to contributors once construction is complete. Live the eco experience! Take a vacation in Sayulita and join in on the practices. See the perk options for more treats included.

Note: All eco home renters must adhere to the TierraLuz eco community rules/regulations.  See website: www.tierraluz.org

Referrals: If you are a contributor to this campaign, there are more opportunities for you to save money! For every eco home rental perk option purchased by someone you referred, you will receive a $100 discount off your eco home rental with Sayulita ECO RETREATS! This could result in several hundred dollars savings or more. If you have selected an eco home rental perk, and you have a successful referral, we will refund your money at the end of the campaign. Your referral must be tracked within Indiegogo in order for it to be valid.

Important! Be sure to log in to your Indiegogo account when you share the link to this crowdfunding page. This will enable us and you to track your referral success. Your unique ID (referral code) will display on the Indiegogo project dashboard. Thank you for spreading the success of this campaign and we look forward to seeing you in Sayulita!

Corporate Sponsorship

Get your brand and products in front of influential decision makers who are interested in making effective environmentally friendly changes in their lifestyle and/or workplace.  Must be approved by Sayulita ECO RETREATS as a worthy eco-friendly company/product/service.

A. $500 donation (eco product or monetary contribution - unlimited donations accepted)

  • Individuals or businesses who provide a product or service get their photo and bio on the supporters page on the Sayulita ECO RETREATS website
  • Link in resources page on Sayulita ECO RETREATS website
  • Shout out via Twitter/Facebook

B. $2,500 donation (eco product or monetary contribution - unlimited donations accepted)

  • Everything listed in “A” above
  • Advertisement on the Sayulita ECO RETREATS website with hyperlink to your website
  • Logo (as an official sponsor) and link on Sayulita ECO RETREATS website
  • Recognition during the Sayulita ECO RETREATS discussions / ecological training 

C. $5,000 donation (eco product or monetary contribution - 5 donations accepted)

  • Everything listed in “A” & “B” above
  • Logo (as an official sponsor) on e-mails sent by Sayulita ECO RETREATS 
  • Logo (as an official sponsor) on video training modules produced by Sayulita ECO RETREATS
  • 2-minute spotlight at a workshop
  • Sponsors providing monetary contributions of $4,000 or more get complimentary registration to an Eco Retreat (restrictions apply)

D. $10,000 donation (eco product or monetary contribution - 5 donations accepted)

  • Everything listed in “A”, “B” and “C” above
  • Promote your product/services through your own qualified and professional presenter(s)

E. $25,000 donation (eco product or monetary contribution - 1 donations accepted)

  • Everything listed in “A”, “B”, “C” and “D” above
  • For 5 years, your name/company’s logo/slogan goes on all marketing correspondence

F. $50,000 donation (eco product or monetary contribution - 1 donations accepted)

  • Everything listed in “A”, “B”, “C”, “D” and “E” above
  • Your 15 second commercial/video precedes videos created by Sayulita ECO RETREATS
  • Your name/logo becomes the name for the Training Centre

Website: www.sayulitaecoretreats.com

Facebook:  http://www.facebook.com/sayulitaecoretreats

Doreen's BIO

Doreen Jacklin is the owner of nPRES Consulting and founder of Sayulita ECO RETREATS. She specializes in creating environments to achieve meaningful growth and on-going success. She holds a masters in Organizational Psychology, a bachelor’s degree in Management and a second level degree in Reiki (holistic transformational technique using universal life-force energy). Doreen is sought after for her expertise in developing and facilitating learning, supporting personal/professional development and sustainable processes. She is also a two time award winner for Motivational Achievement and Human Relations.

“As I said before, I really like the environment in the class and the fact that everyone is engaged and participate. The teacher empowers us and gives us the opportunity grow and to improve our skills and knowledge.”

“It was my first time I can say I really enjoy the class. Everything changed because of Doreen, she is passionate, enthusiastic, helpful. The best teacher ever!”

“I really enjoy the course and I think one of the main reasons is Doreen. She is really enthusiastic and does her best every day which is highly motivating.”

Besides her business, Doreen is also a Travel Specialist with HSK Travel Specialists and serves on the Board of Directors for the British Columbia Organization Development Network. To learn more about Doreen, go to her LinkedIn account: https://ca.linkedin.com/pub/doreen-jacklin/14/436/796

About nPRES Consulting: nPRES Consulting was established in Canada in 2013. The name stands for its values: natural performance, relationships, empowerment and sustainability. The business provides system-based process solutions to assist individuals, families, and businesses.The motivating services come in the form of consulting/coaching, developing learning/training and facilitating retreats. nPRES is currently creating retreats in Sayulita, Mexico.

Sayulita ECO RETREATS is an inspiring experience for individuals, families, schools, business leaders and teams looking for an opportunity to connect with nature and enhance their life/work practices in a sustainable way. Nature is its own teacher, and sometimes all you need is a space to reflect, discuss life/work enhancement ideas, and engage in activities and projects that unleash your own sustainable solutions. Why not also do it in a beautiful location like Sayulita, Mexico, where the sun is warm and sand is soft? Remove yourself from your day-to-day tension and distractions to fully experience alternative sustainable ideas that align your practices with your natural surroundings. Visit our website for upcoming opportunities: www.sayulitaecoretreats.com.
story_txt:
As Gandhi has inspired, we are being the change and invite you to join us. How can you make a difference in the world? One of the most empowering answers is - Change yourself! So we are. If you like our plan, we want to help you to do the same. Ron, my partner, and I have been inspired to help with some of today’s challenges (global warming, unsustainable practices, feeling disengaged and unenergetic, lack of confidence in our government system, etc.). We have taken the plunge to live lighter on Earth, feel healthier and enjoy life more. We started our change by joining an eco community called TierraLuz in Sayulita, Mexico (north of Puerto Vallarta). Together, the community members are creating sustainable processes to support a more tranquil environment that is in harmony with nature.

Does this idea appeal to you too? If so, GREAT! I think you will like what you will learn next… Ron and I plan to build a showcase eco home and training centre. The experience is to empower other like-minded individuals, families and organizations to experience and explore the change for themselves. The retreats will incorporate nature, community, eco friendly technology, sustainable processes and spirit. I have created this crowdfunding initiative to fund the Sayulita ECO RETREATS project. This project will be managed through a company I own called nPRES Consulting. See my bio below to learn more.
“A good example has twice the value of good advice.”– Author Unknown
First Draft of the Property Layout
What do the perks include?
Special for this crowdfunding initiative, Sayulita ECO RETREATS will offer experiential opportunities to practice and explore eco living. Select your level of engagement.

Tours
Workshops
Retreats
Eco home rental

More details of these opportunities is provided below under Sayulita ECO RETREATS Crowdfunding Special Perks. There are also sponsorship opportunities for businesses who develop eco friendly, sustainable technology. See the Sponsorship section below.
Participate in this crowdfunding initiative and you will also be supporting a chain of sustainable efforts. There are others within the local community who are promoting sustainable practices that we support, such as the development of the TierraLuz eco community and a local eco school called Costa Verde International School. Money raised involving tours to this local community initiatives will result in a donation to their cause.
The luscious TierraLuz eco community is a beautiful span of green land pressed up against jungle. The community members have various stunning views of jungle and ocean. Common areas are being developed to contribute to their collaborative, sustainable practices. They are currently in the middle of development. To further develop and maintain the community, a donation fund has been created. Sayulita ECO RETREATS will donate $20 USD to this fund for every perk sold involving the TierraLuz tour.

The Costa Verde International School runs solely on fundraisers and donations. Their small school environment is mostly open to nature with the food they eat for lunch growing around them. The students' learning environment is one big sustainable system and truly amazing to comprehend. Andy Slavin, Costa Verde International School Director, will provide you with a tour of their systems and share the sustainable values and practices they teach the students. Andy has over 20 years of experience in education. Before this position, he was the Principal of the Green School in Bali, Indonesia. He has much to share about sustainable processes and eco friendly practices. Sayulita ECO RETREATS will donate $20 USD to the school for every perk sold involving the eco school tour.“Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle” – Buddha

Proposed Lot in TierraLuz
The property is located at the top of eco community with a view of the ocean and jungle. The eco-community is a 20-minute walk away from the soft, sandy beach near downtown Sayulita. The location is perfect because it is close enough to town to get there quickly with an electric golf cart, yet far enough to drown out the noise from the late night partying.Floor Plan for Eco-HomeWe have hired Jorge Siemen, Architecture and Design, to create the layout of the property structures. The image above is the first draft. The layout of the home has 3 bedrooms. It’s organized so that the whole home or individual suites can be rented out. The home and the training centre will balance the use of local and natural building materials (rocks/earth bags/etc.) and other creative solutions to meet home needs (e.g., solar energy, water waste systems, etc.) while minimizing costs. The training centre is located lower on the hill near the parking lot and can accommodate a maximum of 20 people. We are currently working through the sustainable processes, experimenting with options.
You may be familiar with recycling your glass/plastics/paper.  You may even drive an eco-friendly vehicle.  But does your home recycle rain water?  Is your bodily waste turned into compost?  Is your grey water redirected to a pond where it is naturally filtered to water your outdoor plants? Is your counter-top made by local artisans or was it imported from another country?  Do you know where your veggies come from?  How about your eggs or cheese...fish or other meats? Keep your own bees and make your honey?  Dehydrate and can your own food. We may be doing this. Maybe not all on our own, but as a thriving community. Our eco community ideas are still coming together. And we want to show you how we do this and why it is important!
Risks & Challenges
We have done our homework with the industry trends, location and the direction our future is taking us. Sayulita ECO RETREATS combines the industries within today’s leading trends: Tourism and Wellness. In addition, the project serves the public’s interests to learn about sustainability and take more meaningful action. This is referred to as Ecotourism or Sustainable Tourism. To make it accessible, Mexico is an ideal location. It is a common personal or business retreat location for North Americans. It is also one of the more affordable locations. This project is needed. More advocates are sharing the environmental changes we are going to be forced to deal with. If there is a time to come together and learn, it’s now. We want to create the space.
When Ron and I have shared our ideas within our networks, many have expressed their interest in our project. In fact, some have already visited Sayulita as a result of our discussions. There is no question there is interest in what we are doing and its benefits. There is also no question in our level of commitment. Personally, we have invested over $50,000 USD to this project. We have already grounded our commitment to make it happen, it is now time to build.
We are currently working on the designs of the property and structures. The eco-community members have been sharing their experience and knowledge to help us to succeed. There are a number of approvals we still need to receive through the eco-community and the Mexican government. Besides the building of the project, we are also learning a new culture and government system. We plan to continue to work towards our milestones and deal with unforeseen circumstances as they arise. We appreciate all the support we have received already. We hope you will join us and be the change.
Where will the money go? 
To the construction of the model eco home and training centre
To the start-up costs of Sayulita ECO RETREATS
Any money left-over will be invested to empower others who are working towards the same vision.
Tell me more!


Doreen Teaching
